IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: On December 5, 2023, Master Trooper Jeffrey Claycomb #0604 received a case from Corporal John Feaster of the MSP Licensing Division Firearms Registration Unit (FRU) involving a stolen firearm that had come into the possession of a licensed FFL Dealer operating under the business name of 2A Sales Supplies located at 8610 Washington Boulevard Suite 209 Jessup, Maryland 20794. On 11/27/2023 Mr. David Diehl Manly, White/Male, DOB: 08/12/1963, entered 2A Sales Supplies gun store and elected to purchase a Colt, Model: Detective Special, .38 caliber, revolver, bearing serial# 964164. Mr. Manly then filed an MSP 77R Application to Purchase a Firearm with the store sales associate, identified as Mr. Robert Wengert. On 11/28/2023, the application form was submitted to the FRU for review and approval. On 12/04/2023, Corporal John Feaster, supervisor of the FRU marked this application as DISAPPROVED and initiated Disapproval case# 2023F-659. The reason for this disapproval occurred during the background investigation process. While checking the gun query section in the NCIC computer, Corporal Feaster discovered that this firearm had been reported as stolen by the Columbus Ohio Police Department over 44 years ago on 07/04/1979. The revolver was reported stolen in NCIC under NIC#G245027107 on 07/05/1979. On 12/07/2023, an email was forwarded to 2A Sales Supplies requesting confirmation of their current possession of this firearm. Later, a response email was received from 2A Sales Supplies who confirmed the firearm was currently part of their store inventory. They were advised of the stolen status of the firearm and a mutually agreed time was scheduled to pick up the firearm from them at 1130 hours that day. Upon reaching the store, I made contact with Mr. Mark Paxton, the store owner. Mr. Paxton provided me with the revolver for an examination of the serial number. Upon checking the serial number, it was found to be an exact match to the serial number depicted on the stolen firearm entry from NCIC. Contact was then made with the MSP Waterloo Barrack for assistance in making a notification to the Columbus Police Department informing them of the recovery. Waterloo Barrack PCO, Samantha Palmer received a hit confirmation response from the Columbus P.D. at 1345 Hours and subsequently placed the locate to the Columbus P.D. at 1347 hours. Also, while at the store, I questioned Mr. Paxton regarding how he had come into possession of the firearm. Mr. Paxton informed me the gun had been purchased for $400 from Ms. Janet Ruth Davenport, White/Female, DOB: 06/09/1952 who resides at 11981 Simpson Road Clarksville, Maryland 21029. Phone: 410-531-3495 (L) + 410-707-2261 on 10/05/2023. Following the recovery of the revolver, Mr. Paxton was provided with a copy of the MSP Form 67 Chain of Custody Log Form as a receipt for his records. The recovered firearm was later transported to MSP/CED Headquarters where it was packaged and processed following MSP policy procedures. The recovered firearm was recorded and logged into evidence storage under Property Held Record# 344700. D/SGT Matthew Murphy #2936 was verbally notified the same day to contact the Columbus P.D. Evidence Property Room at 614-645-4736 to coordinate with Detective Brett Slaughter #331 to help facilitate the return of the firearm back to its rightful owner if that was to be the desire of their department. Later, on, 12/08/2023, I obtained a copy of the original theft report from Ms. Annette Richardson from the Columbus P.D. Records Department, which showed the original owner of the revolver to be Mr. Anthony Colosimo. Contact was made with the Columbus P.D. Property Unit to determine if Mr. Colosimo wanted to get his gun back. However, according to Detective Brett Slaughter of the Columbus P.D., Mr. Colosimo died on 11/04/2018 and there was no need for the firearm. In light of this new information, Detective Slaughter said there was no reason to return this firearm to his agency. The firearm is no longer entered into NCIC. On 12/12/2023, Sgt. David Feltman #0915 transported the Colt Revolver back to 2A Sales Supplies gun store and provided it directly to the store owner Mark Paxton at 1133 hours. As a result of the successful recovery of this firearm, I request this case be closed. Case closed.
